newsitem.title: REPUBLIC OF IRELAND: Irish May consumer prices rise 0.2 pct m/m-CSO.
newsitem.headline: Irish May consumer prices rise 0.2 pct m/m-CSO.

text.p: Irish consumer prices, as measured by the consumer price index, rose 0.2 percent on the month and were up 1.5 percent year-on-year, the Central Statistics Office (CSO) said on Friday.
Economists had forecast a rise of 0.3-0.4 percent on April and expected the index to be up 1.5 to 1.6 percent on May last year.
The European Union harmonised index of consumer prices (HICP), which is used for intra-EU comparison, was up 0.1 percent on the month and 1.4 percent year-on-year.
Excluding mortgage interest, the index was unchanged on April and up 1.3 percent on May l996.
